issue.title: news.gifi.fr
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://news.gifi.fr/XyMwTH1v1KwzCvktsgfcLo/LQFsFHjC9SwmTgsb/diGNjSDgmXbzRuQz/6Z3xGYYwYrqttRvi/S_UOW9mNQOnPGEfo/TeLD0RcH65XIj76i/Q-g/fcAC.php?ID=CSHUP2mR](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnews.gifi.fr%2FXyMwTH1v1KwzCvktsgfcLo%2FLQFsFHjC9SwmTgsb%2FdiGNjSDgmXbzRuQz%2F6Z3xGYYwYrqttRvi%2FS_UOW9mNQOnPGEfo%2FTeLD0RcH65XIj76i%2FQ-g%2FfcAC.php%3FID%3DCSHUP2mR) ### Comment > Les e-mails promotionnels des magasins Gifi que je reçois dans ma boîte de réception iOS Outlook affichent des images remplacées par des petits points d’interrogation bleus (voir capture jointe) lorsque AdGuard est activé. Dès que je désactive l’application AdGuard, les images apparaissent correctement dans ma boîte mails. Si je clique sur le lien en haut de la newsletters « voir la version en ligne », les images s’affichent correctement. Espérant avoir été clair et précis dans mes explications. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/s65uzfz1j2oc4w8okcocs40k8gccccgnuw3dtird40.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/4l2qo7859vk0kw4so0gwc8gcww0cgskpem7qh240v4.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.11 License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | server: `https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query`
filters: `https://filters.adtidy.org/dns/filter_1_ios.txt` Filters: | Ad blocking:

comment.body: Seems so. On desktop there's a self-link under `.bnr-list`. Can be excluded like `misatopi.com##.bnr-list > li > a:not([href^="http://www.misatopi.com"])`, but in this case I think it's acceptable to hide with `misatopi.com##.bnr-list` for simplicity and neater and cleaner look, as the self-link is redundant.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
